main_definition: A bubble refers to a spherical or round object, usually filled with air or gas, that appears in various contexts such as physical objects, metaphorical expressions, and financial situations.

meanings_and_examples.example: When you blow soap bubbles with a wand, they float through the air before popping.
The dot-com bubble of the late 1990s saw a rapid rise and subsequent fall in tech stock prices.
His ego had grown into a metaphorical bubble, causing him to be oblivious to the reality around him.
When you pour dish soap into running water, it creates small, round bubbles that rise to the surface and pop.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Bubble as a shape or object
meanings_and_examples.example: A child blowing up a balloon until it becomes a large, round bubble-like shape.
